intro: Velarum erysimoides, commonly known as the slender yellowweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered with fine hairs. Velarum erysimoides is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils and rocky areas.
